body.p: The type of numbering is controlled by the parameter args.css.param.numbering.
This parameter activates various sets of CSS rules from the built-in CSS. By default, only the first-level topics (the chapters) are numbered (shallow numbering). The following values are accepted:

row.entry: counted from the start of the publication
from the start of the publication
counted from the start of the publication
from the start of the publication
numbering is restarted at the beginning of each chapter, adds the chapter number in their titles (and in the links to them), and in the list of tables and list of figures sections
restarted at the beginning of each chapter
numbering is restarted at the beginning of each chapter, adds the chapter number in their titles (and in the links to them), and in the list of tables and list of figures sections
from the start of the publication

dlentry.dd: Each chapter is numbered, but sections are not numbered. Figures, tables, and pages are numbered sequentially from the start of the publication and they do not reset.1. First Chapter Page 1 Section Table 1 Table 2 Section Page 2 Table 3 2. Second Chapter Page 3 Section Table 4 Table 5 Section Page 4

Each chapter and section is numbered (sections are prefixed with the chapter number). Figures, tables, and pages are numbered sequentially from the start of the publication and they do not reset.1. First Chapter Page 1 Section 1.1 Table 1 Section 1.2 Table 2 Page 2 Table 3 2. Second Chapter Page 3 Section 2.1 Table 4 Table 5 Section 2.2 Page 4

Each chapter is independent (so it can be read separately, as a separate part of your publication). The section, page, figure, and table counters (and links to them) restart at each chapter. The general cross reference links also display the chapter number before the page number to clearly specify the target.1. The section, figure, and table counters (and links to them) restart at each chapter, but the page numbers do not reset. The generic cross reference links contain only the page number.1.
